sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition:

8x + 4y + 2z = 24

4x + 13y + 5z = 25

2x + 5z = 5

Round the solution to two decimal places.
message_2:
First, let's rewrite the system of linear equations as a matrix equation Ax = b:

A = | 8  4  2 |      x = | x |      b = | 24 |
    | 4 13  5 |          | y |          | 25 |
    | 2  0  5 |          | z |          |  5 |

Now, we will perform Cholesky decomposition on matrix A. The goal is to find a lower triangular matrix L such that A = LL^T.

L = | l11  0   0  |      L^T = | l11 l21 l31 |
    | l21 l22  0  |             |  0   l22 l32 |
    | l31 l32 l33 |             |  0    0  l33 |

We can find the elements of L using the following equations:

l11 = sqrt(a11) = sqrt(8) = 2*sqrt(2)
l21 = a21 / l11 = 4 / (2*sqrt(2)) = sqrt(2)
l31 = a31 / l11 = 2 / (2*sqrt(2)) = 1/sqrt(2)

l22 = sqrt(a22 - l21^2) = sqrt(13 - 2) = sqrt(11)
l32 = (a32 - l31*l21) / l22 = (0 - (1/sqrt(2))*sqrt(2)) / sqrt(11) = -1/sqrt(11)

l33 = sqrt(a33 - l31^2 - l32^2) = sqrt(5 - (1/2) - (1/11)) = sqrt(33/22)

Now we have L and L^T:

L = |  2*sqrt(2)    0         0      |
    |    sqrt(2)  sqrt(11)    0      |
    | 1/sqrt(2) -1/sqrt(11) sqrt(33/22) |

L^T = |  2*sqrt(2)   sqrt(2)  1/sqrt(2)  |
      |    0       sqrt(11) -1/sqrt(11)  |
      |    0         0      sqrt(33/22)  |

Now we can solve the system of linear equations using forward and backward substitution:

1. Solve Ly = b for y using forward substitution:

|  2*sqrt(2)    0         0      | | y1 |   | 24 |
|    sqrt(2)  sqrt(11)    0      | | y2 | = | 25 |
| 1/sqrt(2) -1/sqrt(11) sqrt(33/22)| | y3 |   |  5 |

y1 = 24 / (2*sqrt(2)) = 6/sqrt(2)
y2 = (25 - sqrt(2)*y1) / sqrt(11) = (25 - 6) / sqrt(11) = 19/sqrt(11)
y3 = (5 - (1/sqrt(2))*y1 + (1/sqrt(11))*y2) / sqrt(33/22) = (5 - 3 + 19/11) / sqrt(33/22) = 22/sqrt(33)

2. Solve L^Tx = y for x using backward substitution:

|  2*sqrt(2)   sqrt(2)  1/sqrt(2)  | | x |   |  6/sqrt(2)  |
|    0       sqrt(11) -1/sqrt(11)  | | y | = | 19/sqrt(11) |
|    0         0      sqrt(33/22)  | | z |   | 22/sqrt(33) |

z = (22/sqrt(33)) / sqrt(33/22) = 1
y = (19/sqrt(11) + (1/sqrt(11))*z) / sqrt(11) = 2
x = (6/sqrt(2) - sqrt(2)*y - (1/sqrt(2))*z) / (2*sqrt(2)) = 3

So the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 3
y = 2
z = 1
